quotes.quote: There are two modes of establishing our reputation: to be praised by honest men, and to be abused by rogues. It is best, however, to secure the former, because it will invariably be accompanied by the latter.
quotes.author: Charles Caleb Colton

quotes.quote: You can't build a reputation on what you are going to do.
quotes.author: Henry Ford

quotes.quote: Propriety was a rigid master, but one that must be obeyed if one wanted to keep a sterling reputation.
quotes.author: Lawana Blackwell

quotes.quote: A good name, like good will, is got by many actions and lost by one.
quotes.author: Lord Jeffery

quotes.quote: Until you've lost your reputation, you never realize what a burden it was.
quotes.author: Margaret Mitchell

quotes.quote: One can survive everything, nowadays, except death, and live down everything except a good reputation.
quotes.author: Oscar Wilde

quotes.quote: A good reputation is more valuable than money.
quotes.author: Publilius Syrus

It has to be a personal ethos to which you adhere despite third party influence or acceptance. The old measuring sticks for professionalism are going away and now more than ever it�s time for independent creatives to set the bar. Set it high.
quotes.author: Socrates

quotes.quote: Regard your good name as the richest jewel you can possibly be possessed of - for credit is like fire; when once you have kindled it you may easily preserve it, but if you once extinguish it, you will find it an arduous task to rekindle it again. The way to gain a good reputation is to endeavor to be what you desire to appear.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote:
Good name in man and woman, dear my lord,
Is the immediate jewel of their souls:
Who steals my purse steals trash; 'tis something, nothing;
'Twas mine, 'tis his, and has been slave to thousands;
But he that filches from me my good name
Robs me of that which not enriches him
And makes me poor indeed.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Oh, I have lost my reputation! I have lost the immortal part of myself, and what remains is bestial.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: Reputation is an idle and most false imposition; oft got without merit, and lost without deserving.
quotes.author: William Shakespeare

quotes.quote: The purest treasure mortal times afford is spotless reputation; that away, men are but gilded loam or painted clay.
